functions.label: getSpaceColor
description:
Determines the color for the provided space.
If a color is present on the Space itself, then that is used.
Otherwise, a color is provided from EUI's Visualization Colors based on the space name.

children.label: space
description: the space.

functions.label: getSpaceImageUrl
description: Determines the avatar image for the provided space.

children.label: space
description: the space.

functions.label: getSpaceInitials
description:
Determines the initials for the provided space.
If initials are present on the Space itself, then that is used.
Otherwise, the initials are calculated based off the words in the space name, with a max length of 2 characters.

children.label: space
description: the space.

interfaces.label: CopyToSpaceFlyoutProps
description: Properties for the CopyToSpaceFlyout.

children.label: savedObjectTarget
description: The object to render the flyout for.

children.label: onClose
description: Optional callback when the flyout is closed.

interfaces.label: CopyToSpaceSavedObjectTarget
description: Describes the target saved object during a copy operation.

children.label: type
description: The object's type.

children.label: id
description: The object's ID.

children.label: namespaces
description: The namespaces that the object currently exists in.

children.label: icon
description:
The EUI icon that is rendered in the flyout's subtitle.

Default is 'apps'.

children.label: title
description:
The string that is rendered in the flyout's subtitle.

Default is `${type} [id=${id}]`.

interfaces.label: EmbeddableLegacyUrlConflictProps
description: Properties for the EmbeddableLegacyUrlConflict component.

children.label: targetType
description: The target type of the legacy URL alias.

children.label: sourceId
description: The source ID of the legacy URL alias.

interfaces.label: GetSpaceResult
description: Response format when querying for spaces.

children.label: authorizedPurposes
description: A set of flags indicating which purposes the user is authorized for.

interfaces.label: LegacyUrlConflictProps
description: Properties for the LegacyUrlConflict component.

children.label: objectNoun
description:
The string that is used to describe the object in the callout, e.g., _There is a legacy URL for this page that points to a different
**object**_.

Default value is 'object'.

children.label: currentObjectId
description: The ID of the object that is currently shown on the page.

children.label: otherObjectId
description: The ID of the other object that the legacy URL alias points to.

children.label: otherObjectPath
description:
The path within your application to use for the new URL, optionally including `search` and/or `hash` URL components. Do not include
 `/app/my-app` or the current base path.

interfaces.label: ShareToSpaceFlyoutProps
description: Properties for the ShareToSpaceFlyout.

children.label: savedObjectTarget
description: The object to render the flyout for.

children.label: flyoutIcon
description:
The EUI icon that is rendered in the flyout's title.

Default is 'share'.

children.label: flyoutTitle
description:
The string that is rendered in the flyout's title.

Default is 'Edit spaces for object'.

children.label: enableCreateCopyCallout
description:
When enabled, if the object is not yet shared to multiple spaces, a callout will be displayed that suggests the user might want to
create a copy instead.

Default value is false.

children.label: enableCreateNewSpaceLink
description:
When enabled, if no other spaces exist _and_ the user has the appropriate privileges, a sentence will be displayed that suggests the
user might want to create a space.

Default value is false.

children.label: behaviorContext
description:
When set to 'within-space' (default), the flyout behaves like it is running on a page within the active space, and it will prevent the
user from removing the object from the active space.

Conversely, when set to 'outside-space', the flyout behaves like it is running on a page outside of any space, so it will allow the
user to remove the object from the active space.

children.label: changeSpacesHandler
description:
Optional handler that is called when the user has saved changes and there are spaces to be added to and/or removed from the object and
its relatives. If this is not defined, a default handler will be used that calls `/api/spaces/_update_objects_spaces` and displays a
toast indicating what occurred.
signature: ((objects: { type: string; id: string; }[], spacesToAdd: string[], spacesToRemove: string[]) => Promise<void>) | undefined

children.label: onUpdate
description: Optional callback when the target object and its relatives are updated.
signature: ((updatedObjects: { type: string; id: string; }[]) => void) | undefined

children.label: onClose
description: Optional callback when the flyout is closed.

interfaces.label: ShareToSpaceSavedObjectTarget
description: Describes the target saved object during a share operation.

children.label: type
description: The object's type.

children.label: id
description: The object's ID.

children.label: namespaces
description: The namespaces that the object currently exists in.

children.label: icon
description:
The EUI icon that is rendered in the flyout's subtitle.

Default is 'empty'.

children.label: title
description:
The string that is rendered in the flyout's subtitle.

Default is `${type} [id=${id}]`.

children.label: noun
description:
The string that is used to describe the object in several places, e.g., _Make **object** available in selected spaces only_.

Default value is 'object'.

interfaces.label: Space
description: A Space.

children.label: id
description:
The unique identifier for this space.
The id becomes part of the "URL Identifier" of the space.

Example: an id of `marketing` would result in the URL identifier of `/s/marketing`.

children.label: name
description: Display name for this space.

children.label: description
description: Optional description for this space.

children.label: color
description:
Optional color (hex code) for this space.
If neither `color` nor `imageUrl` is specified, then a color will be automatically generated.

children.label: initials
description:
Optional display initials for this space's avatar. Supports a maximum of 2 characters.
If initials are not provided, then they will be derived from the space name automatically.

Initials are not displayed if an `imageUrl` has been specified.

children.label: imageUrl
description:
Optional base-64 encoded data image url to show as this space's avatar.
This setting takes precedence over any configured `color` or `initials`.

children.label: disabledFeatures
description: The set of feature ids that should be hidden within this space.

children.label: _reserved
description:
Indicates that this space is reserved (system controlled).
Reserved spaces cannot be created or deleted by end-users.

interfaces.label: SpaceAvatarProps
description: Properties for the SpaceAvatar component.

children.label: space
description: The space to represent with an avatar.
signature: { id?: string | undefined; name?: string | undefined; description?: string | undefined; color?: string | undefined; initials?: string | undefined; imageUrl?: string | undefined; disabledFeatures?: string[] | undefined; _reserved?: boolean | undefined; }

children.label: size
description: The size of the avatar.

children.label: className
description: Optional CSS class(es) to apply.

children.label: announceSpaceName
description:
When enabled, allows EUI to provide an aria-label for this component, which is announced on screen readers.

Default value is true.

children.label: isDisabled
description:
Whether or not to render the avatar in a disabled state.

Default value is false.

interfaces.label: SpaceListProps
description: Properties for the SpaceList component.

children.label: namespaces
description: The namespaces of a saved object to render into a corresponding list of spaces.

children.label: displayLimit
description:
Optional limit to the number of spaces that can be displayed in the list. If the number of spaces exceeds this limit, they will be
hidden behind a "show more" button. Set to 0 to disable.

Default value is 5.

children.label: behaviorContext
description:
When set to 'within-space' (default), the space list behaves like it is running on a page within the active space, and it will omit the
active space (e.g., it displays a list of all the _other_ spaces that an object is shared to).

Conversely, when set to 'outside-space', the space list behaves like it is running on a page outside of any space, so it will not omit
the active space.

interfaces.label: SpacesApiUi
description: UI components and services to add spaces capabilities to an application.

children.label: components
description: Lazy-loadable {@link SpacesApiUiComponent | React components} to support the Spaces feature.

children.label: redirectLegacyUrl
description:
Redirect the user from a legacy URL to a new URL. This needs to be used if a call to `SavedObjectsClient.resolve()` results in an
`"aliasMatch"` outcome, which indicates that the user has loaded the page using a legacy URL. Calling this function will trigger a
client-side redirect to the new URL, and it will display a toast to the user.

Consumers need to determine the local path for the new URL on their own, based on the object ID that was used to call
`SavedObjectsClient.resolve()` (old ID) and the object ID in the result (new ID). For example...

The old object ID is `workpad-123` and the new object ID is `workpad-e08b9bdb-ec14-4339-94c4-063bddfd610e`.

Full legacy URL: `https://localhost:5601/app/canvas#/workpad/workpad-123/page/1`

New URL path: `#/workpad/workpad-e08b9bdb-ec14-4339-94c4-063bddfd610e/page/1`

The protocol, hostname, port, base path, and app path are automatically included.

children.label: path
description: The path to use for the new URL, optionally including `search` and/or `hash` URL components.

children.label: objectNoun
description:
The string that is used to describe the object in the toast, e.g., _The **object** you're looking for has a new
location_. Default value is 'object'.

children.label: useSpaces
description: Helper function to easily access the Spaces React Context provider.

interfaces.label: SpacesApiUiComponent
description: React UI components to be used to display the Spaces feature in any application.

children.label: getSpacesContextProvider
description: Provides a context that is required to render some Spaces components.
signature: ) => React.ReactElement<any, string | ((props: any) => React.ReactElement<any, string | any | (new (props: any) => React.Component<any, any, any>)> | null) | (new (props: any) => React.Component<any, any, any>)>

children.label: getShareToSpaceFlyout
description:
Displays a flyout to edit the spaces that an object is shared to.

Note: must be rendered inside of a SpacesContext.
signature: ) => React.ReactElement<any, string | ((props: any) => React.ReactElement<any, string | any | (new (props: any) => React.Component<any, any, any>)> | null) | (new (props: any) => React.Component<any, any, any>)>

children.label: getCopyToSpaceFlyout
description:
Displays a flyout to copy an object to other spaces.

Note: must be rendered inside of a SpacesContext.
signature: ) => React.ReactElement<any, string | ((props: any) => React.ReactElement<any, string | any | (new (props: any) => React.Component<any, any, any>)> | null) | (new (props: any) => React.Component<any, any, any>)>

children.label: getSpaceList
description:
Displays a corresponding list of spaces for a given list of saved object namespaces. It shows up to five spaces (and an indicator for
any number of spaces that the user is not authorized to see) by default. If more than five named spaces would be displayed, the extras
(along with the unauthorized spaces indicator, if present) are hidden behind a button. If '*' (aka "All spaces") is present, it
supersedes all of the above and just displays a single badge without a button.

Note: must be rendered inside of a SpacesContext.
signature: ) => React.ReactElement<any, string | ((props: any) => React.ReactElement<any, string | any | (new (props: any) => React.Component<any, any, any>)> | null) | (new (props: any) => React.Component<any, any, any>)>

children.label: getEmbeddableLegacyUrlConflict
description:
Displays a callout that needs to be used if an embeddable component call to `SavedObjectsClient.resolve()` results in an `"conflict"`
outcome, which indicates that the user has loaded an embeddable which is associated directly with one object (A), *and* with a legacy
URL that points to a different object (B).
signature: ) => React.ReactElement<any, string | ((props: any) => React.ReactElement<any, string | any | (new (props: any) => React.Component<any, any, any>)> | null) | (new (props: any) => React.Component<any, any, any>)>

children.label: getLegacyUrlConflict
description:
Displays a callout that needs to be used if a call to `SavedObjectsClient.resolve()` results in an `"conflict"` outcome, which
indicates that the user has loaded the page which is associated directly with one object (A), *and* with a legacy URL that points to a
different object (B).

In this case, `SavedObjectsClient.resolve()` has returned object A. This component displays a warning callout to the user explaining
that there is a conflict, and it includes a button that will redirect the user to object B when clicked.

Consumers need to determine the local path for the new URL on their own, based on the object ID that was used to call
`SavedObjectsClient.resolve()` (A) and the `alias_target_id` value in the response (B). For example...

A is `workpad-123` and B is `workpad-e08b9bdb-ec14-4339-94c4-063bddfd610e`.

Full legacy URL: `https://localhost:5601/app/canvas#/workpad/workpad-123/page/1`

New URL path: `#/workpad/workpad-e08b9bdb-ec14-4339-94c4-063bddfd610e/page/1`
signature: ) => React.ReactElement<any, string | ((props: any) => React.ReactElement<any, string | any | (new (props: any) => React.Component<any, any, any>)> | null) | (new (props: any) => React.Component<any, any, any>)>

children.label: getSpaceAvatar
description: Displays an avatar for the given space.
signature: ) => React.ReactElement<any, string | ((props: any) => React.ReactElement<any, string | any | (new (props: any) => React.Component<any, any, any>)> | null) | (new (props: any) => React.Component<any, any, any>)>

interfaces.label: SpacesContextProps
description: Properties for the SpacesContext.

children.label: feature
description: If a feature is specified, all Spaces components will treat it appropriately if the feature is disabled in a given Space.

interfaces.label: SpacesData
description: The structure for all of the space data that must be loaded for share-to-space components to function.

children.label: spacesMap
description: A map of each existing space's ID and its associated {@link SpacesDataEntry}.

children.label: activeSpaceId
description: The ID of the active space.

interfaces.label: SpacesDataEntry
description:
The data that was fetched for a specific space. Includes optional additional fields that are needed to handle edge cases in the
share-to-space components that consume it.

children.label: isActiveSpace
description: True if this space is the active space.

children.label: isFeatureDisabled
description: True if the current feature (specified in the `SpacesContext`) is disabled in this space.

children.label: isAuthorizedForPurpose
description: Returns true if the user is authorized for the given purpose.

misc.label: GetAllSpacesPurpose
description:
The set of purposes to retrieve spaces:
- `any`: retrieves all spaces the user is authorized to see.
- `copySavedObjectsIntoSpace`: retrieves all spaces the user is authorized to copy saved objects into.
- `findSavedObjects`: retrieves all spaces the user is authorized to search within.
- `shareSavedObjectsIntoSpace`: retrieves all spaces the user is authorized to share saved objects into.

misc.label: LazyComponentFn
description: Function that returns a promise for a lazy-loadable component.
signature: (props: T) => React.ReactElement<any, string | ((props: any) => React.ReactElement<any, string | any | (new (props: any) => React.Component<any, any, any>)> | null) | (new (props: any) => React.Component<any, any, any>)>

Given a server base path, space id, and requested resource, this will construct a space-aware path
that includes a URL identifier with the space id.

description: the server's base path.

children.label: spaceId
description: the space id.

children.label: requestedPath
description: the requested path (e.g. `/app/dashboard`).

returnComment: the space-aware version of the requested path, inclusive of the server's base path.

interfaces.label: GetAllSpacesOptions
description: Controls how spaces are retrieved.

children.label: purpose
description:
An optional purpose describing how the set of spaces will be used.
The default purpose (`any`) will retrieve all spaces the user is authorized to see,
whereas a more specific purpose will retrieve all spaces the user is authorized to perform a specific action within.

children.label: includeAuthorizedPurposes
description: Set to true to return a set of flags indicating which purposes the user is authorized for.

children.label: authorizedPurposes
